results.title: Opera favourites with Placido Domingo and Kiri Te Kanawa
results.brief_description: Te Kanawa and Domingo are two names which rank amongst the most illustious in the world of opera. Both singers bring consummate skill and artistry to their individual performances, but together they form a partnership which is perfectly balanced, achieving a musical and dramatic rapport. All the exceptional musical and dramatic qualities Te Kanawa and Domingo command can be seen and heard in these magnificent performances. Selections are from; Die Fledermaus, The tales of Hoffmann, Agnes Baltsa, La faniciulladel West, Otello, Ernani, Manon Lescaut.

results.title: Opera
results.brief_description: Animated film lampooning famous operas, including those by Bach, Rossini and Puccini, and developing an anti-pollution theme to a catastrophic climax.

results.title: Opens Wednesday
results.creator_credit: Barrie Nelson and Barrie Nelson Productions
results.brief_description: Opens Wednesday is a romp through a director’s rehearsal of a lively animated show. Nelson’s animated transformations are intimate and spectacular. Partial funding by the American Film Institute and National Endowment for the Arts.

results.title: Openly in the city
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Two different approaches to the problem of educating mentally handicapped children. The first is based on the premise that the children need guidance in personality development as well as basic educational skills, in order that they may gain an identity, and thus an idea of their place in society. The second approach involves perfecting certain skills through structured programs, in the belief that the individual will develop as he masters skills Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: Opening speech: McLaren = Discours de bienvenue de Norman McLaren
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film in which Norman McLaren is caught by his own film tricks. He attempts to welcome the audience but is frustrated by a reluctant microphone that has a will of its own. Originally made for the official opening of the Montreal Film Festival. (Awards: London) Contains both French and English dialogue.

results.title: Opening night
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Al Ruban and Faces Distribution Corporation
results.brief_description: Myrtle Gordon is a successful actress who finds the part she has taken in a new play, about a “defeated, older woman”, humiliating. When a young fan is killed outside the theatre one night, Myrtle uses the experience of the girl and the accident to revisit her youth. While she searches for a vantage-point to perform the part, the film shows how the play and the world behind the play interact and threaten to draw her into collapse.

results.title: Open your eyes = Abre los ojos
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Amenabar, Jose Luis Cuerda, Fernando Bovaira, Sociedad General de Television SA, Lucky Red, Les Films Alain Sarde and Producciones del Escorpión S.L.
results.brief_description: Cesar (Eduardo Noriega) is a very handsome young man and an heir to a huge family fortune. At a party he meets Sofia (Penelope Cruz) and for the first time in his life, he feels love. However, his jealous girlfriend causes a horrific accident which leaves Cesar mutilated, his once beautiful face now disfigured. Furthermore, the accident seems to have thrown Cesar into a nightmare world in which he is accused of murder and one from which he is unable to escape. Told in flashback by Cesar who is being held in a prison for the mentally insane, “Open your eyes” is by turns a horror film, a love story, and a metaphysical puzzle which plays with our notions of beauty, faith and truth. Cameron Crowe remade “Open your eyes” as the Hollywood film, “Vanilla sky”. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Open your eyes
results.creator_credit: Ed Schultz, Carol Hale and Girl Scouts of the USA
results.brief_description: Describes the kinds of effective service which senior girl scouts can give to their communities in small towns and in big cities. Explains that the projects of these teenage girls are related to such subjects as poverty, conservation, disadvantaged pre-school children, Native American affairs, and the physically handicapped.

results.title: Open window
results.creator_credit: Richard Patterson, American Film Institute and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Based on a story by Saki. Frampton Nuttle is a nervous, irresolute character. He retreats from closing a draughty window when Vera appears, twitches and trembles as she tells of the death of uncles, and retreats at the sight of these supposedly dead men suddenly arriving through open windows. Cast includes Britt Leach, Cindy Eilbacher, Mary Wicks, Roslie Williams, Alan Caillou, William Beckley. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
